When i control the plane, they got roll bias. this appear on basic ksp plane too. i think this problem come from center of mass, center of thrust, center of aerodynamic. like this.

This problem appear on my computer only?

Edited March 16, 2018 by GleguS

Welcome to the forums.

To have extra roll stability, you want the Center of Lift of the wings to be above the Center of Mass. Having them at the same height gives neutral roll stability. Your CoL is below your CoM, which will tend to make your plane slightly unstable for roll.

However, if you fly with SAS turned on, it should probably be enough to keep your plane flying mostly straight.

Additionally, adding dihedral to your wings will do something similar to enhance roll stability.
